tool.command:
Rscript $__tool_directory__/concatenation_wrapper.R
dataMatrix_1 "$dataMatrix_1"
dataMatrix_2 "$dataMatrix_2"
metadata_1 "$metadata_1"
metadata_2 "$metadata_2"
type "$type"
tab1 "$tab1"
tab2 "$tab2"
concatenation "$concatenation"
choice_keep "$choice.choice_keep" #if str($choice.choice_keep) == 'yes': keep 0 #end if #if str($choice.choice_keep) == 'no': keep "$choice.keep" #end if
dataMatrix_1_out "$dataMatrix_1_out"

---------------------------------------------------
****************** Concatenation ******************
=========== DESCRIPTION ===========
Allows concatenation of two matrix Metadata and returns a matrix of Metadata and two DataMatrix
---------------------------------------------------
========================== ALIGNMENT WITH OTHER TOOLS ==========================
This tool is designed to work with any type of dataset.
----------- Input files -----------
+----------------------------------+------------+ | Parameter : num + label | Format | +==================================+============+ | 1 : First Data matrix file | tabular | +----------------------------------+------------+ | 2 : First metadata file | tabular | +----------------------------------+------------+ | 3 : Second Data matrix file | tabular | +----------------------------------+------------+ | 4 : Second metadata file | tabular | +----------------------------------+------------+
------------ Output files ------------
+----------------------------------+------------+ | Parameter : num + label | Format | +==================================+============+ | 1 : Metadata concatenate file | tabular | +----------------------------------+------------+ | 2 : First Data matrix file | tabular | +----------------------------------+------------+ | 3 : Second Data matrix file | tabular | +----------------------------------+------------+
---------------------------------------------------
=============== TOOL PARAMETERS ===============
Data matrix | contains the intensity values of the variables. |
Variable metadata file | contains variable information. |
Type of metadata | Specify which type of metadata table is given as Metadata file |
Type of concatenation | Selects the type of concatenation | Unique: individuals are the same in both tables | Intersection: keep only individuals in common | Union: keep all individuals in both tables |
Choice | Favor a matrix in case of matrix with the same name and differents value or keep both | keep both columns and change their names by adding a suffix | keep the column belonging to metadata matrix 1 or metadata 2 |
Suffixe of the column | By default, the suffixes are Tab1 and Tab2 |
================== OUTPUT DESCRIPTION ==================
**Unique**: the tables must have the same identifiers otherwise, a warning will be generated. In this case, you will return the merged metadata without modifying the DataMatrix.
**Intersection**: there must be individuals in common between the two metadata, otherwise an error will be displayed. Moreover, if the number of individuals in common is less than 5, a warning will be generated. The DataMatrix will only keep common individuals.
**Union**: the individuals don't necessarily have to be the same between the metadata. If no individuals are common, a warning will be generated. The modified DataMatrix will then include all the individuals, adding NA values for those that are missing. If common variables exist with no differences between the common individuals, the intersections will be added to the missing individuals.
